item.title: Bandwidth Management Gets Easier With Ethernet
item.description: The unpredictable nature of bandwidth demand, with its constant fluctuations and potential for rapid growth, presents a challenge for IT managers seeking to balance sufficient resources with cost-effectiveness. Traditional procurement processes, designed for less dynamic times, involve lengthy steps from identifying needs to service activation, making it difficult to adapt quickly to changing bandwidth requirements. This problem is exacerbated by legacy telecom services like T1 lines or OC connections, which offer fixed bandwidth levels.
